result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Eugene West

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Louis Eugene West in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Louis Eugene West.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a final pre-trial and jury trial date. State did not object. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion Hearing exhibits from 7/15/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 788.

Defendant Louis Eugene West in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continuation of motion hearing commenced on 7/15/2022 proceeded.  State's presentation of evidence concluded.  Defense has no witnesses.  Arguments heard. Court placed findings on the record and DENIED defense motion to suppress.  Exhibit List, filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Conner Helvig in court.  Alex Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called without the defendant's appearance.  Statements heard as to the motion hearing.  Defrendant Louis West in court.  Motion hearing proceeded.  State informed the court that a sequestration order is not requested.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee police officer (MPO) Thomas Marcus.  Exhibits 1, 2 received.  Sworn for the state:  MPO Miles Kowalik.  Exhibits 3, 4 received.  Matter adjourned for continuation of motion hearing in Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Conner Helvig in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements heard as to defendant's non-appearance.  Case passed.
*
Off the record, Attorney Helvig informed the court that defendant is on his way to court.
defense reply to State's Response Brief, received and filed
States Response to Defendants Motion to Suppress
Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Louis Eugene West in court with Attorney Conner Helvig.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises the Court he has filed a motion to suppress.
Court orders case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 28.

Any response by the State to be filed with the court no later than June 17, 2022.  Any further reply by defense counsel to be filed with the court no than July 8, 2022.

Clerk:  jms
Notice Of Motion And Motion To Suppress Physical Evidence Obtained During Unlawful Entry Into Mr. West's Home And The Subsequent Unlawful Search Within The Home - received

Defendant Louis Eugene West in court by video with Attorney Conner Helvig who appears in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 08CF198. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Kowalik.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Louis Eugene West in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
